title: The Psychedelic Conversation # 4: Slipping the Surly Bonds of Earth w Plato, Aristotle, JV and JBP
description:
A play list of all ten episodes analyzing this conversation: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLoARw9zo4EUYEEhM_KIgzl_eW9ZZTHbzh

Recommended video:
Nima Arkani Hamed, The Morality of Fundamental Physics:
https://youtu.be/5aAMJNVmdoY

Mark's Channel: 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgIbaWd7raqeIGUS1cHNgPg/featured

JBP
Difficult to distinguish between the consciousness of reality and reality itself?

JV
 …Tillich’s idea of the symbol as that which grounds, makes possible the relationship between the subjective and objective....Aristotle would say the mind and the object that is known come into conformity.  I come into conformity with the cup.

JBP
That’s what happens when you pick up the cup according to Piaget.
Mimicking the cup by trying to understand it.

JV
You’re shaping yourself to it which is different. The difference between Cartesian and theological.
Cartesian - I don’t have to undergo transformation fundamentally in who I am in order to know, just properly organize my propositions. But unless I go through transformation, there are deep truths that will not disclose themselves to me.  
People feel themselves being conformed to reality through the Logos.

JBP - So that’s a feeling of personal transformation? Same feeling of tracking - Same as stumbling uphill toward the city of God? …

28:31
JV In the Socratic tradition, there’s no clean separation from knowing the thing and knowing yourself.

JBP Is there a clear separation in the insight experiences?

JV When you start to link them together you can start to get flow experiences

JBP And if you link them together too much, you get non-stop flow experiences and the question then is can you tolerate it?
I’m not sure I can tolerate it.

JV
Hot flow - a lot of metabolic expenditure, but the flow state with tai chi tron, not the same sense that you’re going to burn out.

JBP
I must be in a hot state of flow all the time

JV
The thing about the good state of flow is that it opens up the possibility to have more time to explore that participatory sense.
That sense of at one ment

JBP
Atonement

JV
Exactly

JBP
That pulls original sin into it.

JV
Or the other way around - or original sin made use of at one ment

JBP
As the antidote. As the stuff of the grail, atonemen. That’s the city on the hill, too,
Or the wandering up to the city on a hill.

JV
Pilgrim’s Progress and Augustine’s City of god going thru my head.
When you can get into a cool flow…

JBP Teach me.

JV What we are talking about in these circling practices is shared flow

JBP
my talk with Jonathan Pageau - it got a million and a half views - WTH’s going on?

JV
Jonathan is more radical Christian than he realizes.

JBP
Yes, and I think that might be true of you, too, and quite possibly, it’s also true of me.
You and your Logos, John.

JV
That’s funny cuz I’ve had some Christians say that to me.

JBP
It’s not exactly a trivial compliment, John, old Daoist friend on the border between chaos and order…

33:15
JV
Maybe when people are seeing the spirit of Christ in me, I hope what they are referring to is something that’s coming into my awareness with intelligibility, and that is being actualized in reality. I hope that I’m realizing the Logos with other people.

JBP
Your effect on your students is evidence of that, John. What do you think of your name, John.

JV
John a gift from God

JBP 
My middle name is Berndt, it’s Norwegian.
….. my grandfather….
I had an Indian carver build my third floor which you’ll have to see sometime. He built a totem of me and I’m standing in the arms of a bear. I didn’t know that that was the meaning of my name. That really happened. Who knows what’s in a name.
Jordan Berndt Peterson

JV
John was my favorite gospel.

JBP
Yeah, that makes sense. In the beginning was the Word 

JVYeah the Logos

JBP
That suits you.

What do you make of this comment, that the Spirit of Christ is being manifest in you? 
If you take that seriously, how do you maintain yourself?

JV
also my girlfriend,  who is officially an atheist...

JBP My biggest takeaway was from my Biblical series? The Meaning of Israel.
We who wrestle with God. We who struggle with God. Maybe that’s the real Christian spirit, the Jewish spirit.The wrestling spirit. Why is there that strange scene where he wrestles with the angel? Isn’t that what we’re doing all the time?

JV
He partially wins, though. That’s what is so mysterious.

JBP
And hurts you doing so...But isn’t that the story? Not belief, but wrestling with belief.

So that’s the other metaphor for dialog...and that sums up men’s relationships, tracking and sparring.

JV
Plato’s nickname means wrestler.

JBP
Suits episode. The men are always sparring.

JV
You can shift off of that like me and Bernardo Kastrup - off of victory to the flow state. The aesthetics of the dance, a beautyyou can appreciate for its own sake, independent of victory. Plato talks about the beauty, the eros, the dance that draws you beyond yourself.
